page.title: 08BMX BANDITS LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: In May there was a notice in the local paper about a meeting to form a BMX club in Lossiemouth. There was a poor response but despite that a commitee was formed. The district council leased a bit of land to them for four years and also gave them a grant. Money was raised by holding sales, a disco and a sponsored cycle run. The members drew the plans for the track and had them checked by an engineer. It took two to three months to get planning permission. Many people offered to help, both members and parents. A local building firm sold Quarry Red cheaply. The track was fully operational by November. The BMX club has forty-six members and it costs three pounds to become a member.
